{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3736698,"name":"Murilo Miranda Santos","username":"murilo404","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/49beb7/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-09-11T17:37:13.010Z","cooked":"

Good afternoon everyone, our team is creating a prototype using pneumatics, but we’re having a problem connecting the compressor to the pneumatic hub. When we create the object within the program, it works with all the pneumatic hub functions, but it doesn’t turn on the compressor. When we use “hub.enableCompressorAnalaog(10, 20);”, it doesn’t even turn on the status LED indicating that the compressor is on. We also tried creating the object outside of its CAN ID, but it gives a “not found” error, so we think the problem isn’t with the CAN network. Can anyone help us?

Our code:

package frc.robot;

import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Compressor;
import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.PneumaticHub;
import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.PneumaticsModuleType;
import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.TimedRobot;
import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.XboxController;
import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Command;
import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.CommandScheduler;

public class Robot extends TimedRobot{
RobotContainer m_robotContainer;
XboxController controller;
Command m_autonomousCommand;
PneumaticHub hub = new PneumaticHub(12);
Compressor compressor = new Compressor(12, PneumaticsModuleType.REVPH);

@Override
public void robotInit() {
System.out.println(“robo ligado!”);
m_robotContainer = new RobotContainer();
}

@Override
public void robotPeriodic() {
CommandScheduler.getInstance().run();
}

@Override
public void teleopInit() {
if (m_autonomousCommand != null) {
m_autonomousCommand.cancel();
}
m_robotContainer.cremalheiraSubsystem.resetEncoder();
System.out.println(“Compressor ligando”);
hub.enableCompressorAnalog(10, 20);
System.out.println("versão: " + hub.getVersion());
}

@Override
public void teleopPeriodic() {}
}

We are using it inside the Robot.java just for tests

how are you connecting all the pneumatic components? Do you have the regulator connector and setup properly? Did you put in the pressure relief value/sensor? ← this last one without it as I recalled will not allow the pump to work at all. (been about 4+ years since we last touched one so I could be wrong here).

about the connections wh think are everythng sure, and the sensor is conected. the problem is about the compressor, he didn’t turn on with the pneumatic hub and don’tmake any noise and dont give us any signal of life, but he is working properly.

murilo404:

it works with all the pneumatic hub functions

I don’t see code that does this proof that you have correctly changed the CANID to 12 and the solenoid relays work right. Make sure you have done this.

murilo404:

hub.enableCompressorAnalog(10, 20);

You could try setting the on/off pressures much higher - maybe they are too low for some reason.

I think this statement assumes analog port 0 is being used so make sure that is wired to the sensor.

Also, make sure you have an analog sensor and not a digital sensor.

Clear faults before you do anything else and print out faults to see if there are any.

In the REV Hardware Client it show’s that the analog sensor is in the port 1. about the CAN ID, it’s is inside the constructor of the class “new PneumaticHub()”, puting 12 inside the “()”?

I think the default CANID for Rev pneumatic hub is 1 and if you want something different, you have to set it using the Rev Hardware Client.

Good morning, is this the first time we use it, but doesn’t have problem using the default CAN ID 1? Because we already have 2 devices in this ID, like a spark max and the PDH. Really doesn’t have problem? (sorry for the ask, like I said it’s the first time we use it, and sorry for the bad English too, I’m from Brazil)

You are right that FRC has defined a sort of addressing for their CAN protocol but it includes more than the simple “sequence” number. Manufacturer and device type are a part of the unique ID.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-09-12T12:32:19.782Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":42,"readers_count":41,"score":8.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":506211,"topic_slug":"error-using-rev-pneumatic-hubs","display_username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.wpilib.org/en/stable/docs/software/can-devices/can-addressing.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"FRC CAN Device Specifications — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":77110,"username":"tutu.pandolfi","name":"Arthur Pandolfi Correa","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/eb9ed0/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24594,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/error-using-rev-pneumatic-hubs/506211/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3738242,"name":"Brett B Bonner","username":"bbonner","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bbonner/{size}/155176_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-12T14:07:41.098Z","cooked":"

It’s been a few years since we used pneumatics, so my memory may be rusty. However, my recollection is that:

  • You don’t generally need Compressor objects unless you’re doing something unusual (confirmed, see blue box Note), AND
  • Normal closed-loop compressor control is automatically enabled when you create one or more Solenoid (or DoubleSolenoid) objects. This appears to be confirmed in the Pneumatics Manual on p.6.

It doesn’t look like you’re creating any Solenoid objects so that may be why the controller isn’t running the compressor.

The pneumatics manual linked above may also help you with understanding and connecting all the components.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-09-12T14:07:41.098Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":38,"readers_count":37,"score":27.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":506211,"topic_slug":"error-using-rev-pneumatic-hubs","display_username":"Brett B Bonner","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.wpilib.org/en/stable/docs/software/hardware-apis/pneumatics/pressure.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Generating and Storing Pressure — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation","clicks":0},{"url":"https://www.firstinspires.org/sites/default/files/uploads/resource_library/frc/technical-resources/frc_pneumatics_manual.pdf","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48574,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6328 Mentor - Electrical/Controls"},"post_url":"/t/error-using-rev-pneumatic-hubs/506211/10","custom_user_title":"6328 Mentor - Electrical/Controls","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3738257,"name":"Arthur Pandolfi Correa","username":"tutu.pandolfi","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/eb9ed0/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-09-12T14:47:10.431Z","cooked":"

I was talking with the technician of my team, and he said that the problem might be about the digital sensor, because we are using only the analog. In 13 o’clock, Im on the lab, and I test everything that you and the other guy said, ok?

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-09-12T14:47:10.431Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":34,"readers_count":33,"score":11.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":506211,"topic_slug":"error-using-rev-pneumatic-hubs","display_username":"Arthur Pandolfi Correa","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":48574,"username":"bbonner","name":"Brett B Bonner","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bbonner/{size}/155176_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":77110,"hidden":false,"trust_level":0,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Tutu Pandolfi"},"post_url":"/t/error-using-rev-pneumatic-hubs/506211/11","custom_user_title":"Tutu Pandolfi","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3738334,"name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-12T16:21:11.874Z","cooked":"

It’s okay to use only an analog sensor - that’s what my team uses. It’s unlikely but possible the sensor is bad. You can supply your own 0.5VDC to 5 VDC to the hub and bypass using the sensor. I’m sure you noted in the hub specification that 0 VDC into the sensor port means no sensor connected and I think the compressor is prevented from turning on. So a broken wire in the sensor prevents the compressor from working.

You can also check to see if the sensor is sending 0.5 VDC at 0 PSIG.

Another troubleshooting technique is to follow the WPILib examples exactly as @bbonner had referenced.

murilo404:

When we create the object within the program, it works with all the pneumatic hub functions, but it doesn’t turn on the compressor.

I assumed that you had everything working except the compressor - solenoids work, status lights are correct. But again, there is no proof or code that you actually did exercise all functions of the physical hub.

Again, make sure the CAN ID is set correctly in the Rev Hardware Client. To help yourself and others trying to help you, I suggest a systematic presentation of what you have done and the result. For example, actuate the states of a solenoid in software and record both the code you used and the lights that lit on the hub. Screenshots and pictures of the equipment are invaluable to show others what is happening so they don’t waste time guessing troubles that have already been ruled out.
